bobby.engine.bobengine

Class SoundPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bobby.engine.bobengine.SoundPlayer

  • public class SoundPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    An player used for playing sound effects and music. This class is a simplified wrapper around Android's SoundPool.

    For large music files, use Android's MediaPlayer object instead.
    Author:
    Ben

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void init(Context context)
      Initialize this SoundPlayer with a context and a maximum number of simultaneous sounds of 10.

      Does not have to be used if the context is the same as the context passed when this SoundPool's constructor was called.

      Play a sound and loop it forever.

      Play sound with advanced options.

      Resume a sound that has been paused.

      Resume playing sounds that were paused with pauseAll().

      • SoundPlayer

        public SoundPlayer(Context context)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Context context)
        Initialize this SoundPlayer with a context and a maximum number of simultaneous sounds of 10.

        Does not have to be used if the context is the same as the context passed when this SoundPool's constructor was called.
        Parameters:
        context - - The context from which to retrieve sound resources.

      • init

        public void init(Context context,
                 int maxStreams)
        Initialize this SoundPlayer with a context and a maximum number of simultaneous sounds of maxStreams.

        Parameters:
        context - - The context from which to retrieve sound resources.
        maxStreams - - The maximum number of sounds played at once.

      • newSound

        public int newSound(int soundResource)
        Add a sound to this player so that it can be played. Be sure to store the return value because it is used to play the added sound.
        Parameters:
        soundResource - - The sound resource to add (eg. R.raw.(...))
        Returns:
        The sound ID for the newly added sound. Keep track of this!

      • play

        public int play(int soundID)
        Play a sound. You must the sound first with newSound(resource) to get a sound ID.
        Parameters:
        soundID - - The sound ID from newSound()
        Returns:
        The stream ID. Keep track of this if you need to pause/stop/manipulate this sound while it's playing.

      • play

        public int play(int soundID,
                float volume)
        Play a sound at a specific volume.
        Parameters:
        soundID - - The sound ID from newSound()
        volume - - Volume of the sound, range 0.0 to 1.0
        Returns:
        The stream ID. Keep track of this if you need to pause/stop/manipulate this sound while it's playing.

      • play

        public int play(int soundID,
                float leftVolume,
                float rightVolume,
                int loop,
                int priority,
                float rate)
        Play sound with advanced options.
        Parameters:
        soundID - - The sound ID from newSound()
        leftVolume - - Volume from the left speaker, from 0.0 to 1.0
        rightVolume - - Volume from the right speaker, from 0.0 to 1.0
        loop - - Number of times to loop. 0 to play once, -1 to loop forever.
        priority - - Priority of this stream. 0 is the lowest.
        rate - - Speed of this sound, from 0.5 to 2.0. (1.0 is the normal speed)
        Returns:
        The stream ID. Keep track of this if you need to pause/stop/manipulate this sound while it's playing.

      • loop

        public int loop(int soundID)
        Play a sound and loop it forever.
        Parameters:
        soundID - - the sound ID from newSound()
        Returns:
        The stream ID. Keep track of this if you need to pause/stop/manipulate this sound while it's playing.

      • loop

        public int loop(int soundID,
                int times)
        Play a sound and loop it a specific number of times.
        Parameters:
        soundID - - the sound ID from newSound()
        times - - number of times to loop. 0 to play once, -1 to loop forever.
        Returns:

      • stop

        public void stop(int streamID)
        Stop a sound that is playing.
        Parameters:
        streamID - - The stream ID returned from the function used to play the sound.

      • pause

        public void pause(int streamID)
        Pause a sound that is playing.
        Parameters:
        streamID - - The stream ID returned from the function used to play the sound.

      • resume

        public void resume(int streamID)
        Resume a sound that has been paused.
        Parameters:
        streamID - - The stream ID returned from the function used to play the sound.

      • pauseAll

        public void pauseAll()
        Pause all the sounds that are playing.

      • resumeAll

        public void resumeAll()
        Resume playing sounds that were paused with pauseAll().

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(int streamID,
                      float volume)
        Change the volume of a sound that is playing.
        Parameters:
        streamID - - The stream ID returned from the function used to play the sound.
        volume - - The new volume, range from 0.0 to 1.0

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(int streamID,
                      float leftVolume,
                      float rightVolume)
        Change the volume of a sound that is playing with different volumes for each speaker.
        Parameters:
        streamID - - The stream ID returned from the function used to play the sound.
        leftVolume - - The new left speaker volume, from 0.0 to 1.0
        rightVolume - - The new right speaker volume, from 0.0 to 1.0

      • setRate

        public void setRate(int streamID,
                    float rate)
        Change the rate (speed) at which a sound is playing.
        Parameters:
        streamID - - The stream ID returned from the function used to play the sound.
        rate - - The new rate, from 0.5 to 2.0. (1.0 is the normal rate)
